New Records: New York Yankees' Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit a game-ending infield single with one out in the 11th inning.Juan Soto launched a go-ahead homer in the sixth inning.Salvador Perez hit a tying sacrifice fly off Clay Holmes in the seventh inning.Luke Weaver (5-3) struck out three in 1 2/3 hitless innings for the win.New York took two of three in a series between playoff contenders.Kansas City fell 4 1/2 games behind first-place Cleveland in the AL Central.The Yankees increased their advantage in the AL East to 1 1/2 games over Baltimore.Luis Gil permitted one run and five hits over five innings in his second start following a stint on the injured list due to a back injury.Michael Massey homered in the fourth against Gil, who struck out MJ Melendez with two on to end the fifth.Royals: RHP Michael Lorenzen (strained left hamstring) will make his next minor league rehab start this weekend.Yankees: LHP Nestor Cortes (9-10, 3.97 ERA) opposes Boston RHP Cooper Criswell (6-4, 4.11) in the opener of a four-game series Thursday night.RHP Luis Ortiz (6-5, 3.26 ERA) will pitch for the Pirates.
Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit a walk-off RBI single in the 11th inning.Chisholm came up with runners on first and third after Kris Bubic (0-1) intentionally walked Aaron Judge.Chisholm slapped a 2-1 slider toward shortstop, leading to a game-ending play.The game went into 11 innings, marking a tense and dramatic finish.The Royals tied the game in the 10th inning on a sacrifice fly by Austin Wells.Salvador Perez started an impressive double play to end the bottom half.Chisholm batted cleanup for the second time since being acquired from the Miami Marlins on July 27.It was Chisholm's first career walk-off hit.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees increased their advantage in the AL East to 1 1/2 games over Baltimore.The teams traded runs in the 10th inning.New York held the lead since Aug. 21 but hadn’t led by more than two games during that stretch. Royals pinch-runner Darion Blanco stole third base and scored on Jake Cousins’ wild pitch.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.Royals manager Matt Quatraro acknowledged the tense game and the quality of pitching on both sides.Soto fouled off another pitch off before sending a 402-foot drive to right field.Soto said he felt the pain when he homered but was feeling better after the game.Boone praised Soto's resilience and ability to perform despite the injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a key series win for the Yankees against a strong opponent.The Royals are still in contention for a wild card spot.The Yankees and Royals have a history of intense matchups and playoff contention.The game marked a significant moment in both teams' seasons.Chisholm's walk-off hit was a memorable moment for the Yankees.
Others: The Orioles lost 5-3 in 10 innings at Fenway Park when Tyler O’Neill hit a walk-off homer for Boston.The game was played on September 12, 2024.The article provided detailed coverage of the game's key moments.The Yankees and Royals were both playoff-contending teams at the time.The article included information on player injuries and returns.
